;教皇方济各下周将前往葡萄牙，参加该国年轻天主教徒的全球聚会正在努力处理有关教会成员数十年来对儿童进行性虐待的报告。

;

;这位 86 岁的教皇将于周三抵达里斯本，预计将在他的任期内私下会见神职人员虐待的受害者为期五天的访问，参加世界青年日。

;

;组织者预计将有多达 100 万人参加该活动，由于 Covid-19 大流行，该活动是自 2019 年以来首次举办。< /p>;

;葡萄牙天主教会性虐待 5,000 名儿童的丑闻

;

;此前，一个独立委员会在 2 月份发布了一份报告，发现葡萄牙“至少”有 4,815 名儿童遭到神职人员性虐待。自 1950 年以来，该国大部分是神父。

;

;调查根据 500 多名受害者的证词得出结论，葡萄牙教会等级制度“系统地”试图隐瞒虐待行为。

;

;结果这项由葡萄牙教会委托进行的调查玷污了该国的机构，该国约 1000 万人口中 80% 的人信仰罗马天主教。

;

;葡萄牙里斯本天主教大学进行的一项民意调查发现 68% 的葡萄牙人认为教会的形象已经恶化。

;

;葡萄牙教会高层已向受害者道歉，并认识到“教会文化”必须改变。

;

;但情况似乎存在分歧，一些主教比其他主教更不愿意让受到投诉的神父停职。

;

;报告发布后，教会成立了一个新的独立委员会来支持虐待受害者，收集新的投诉并陪伴施虐者，防止他们再次犯罪。

;

;该组织协调员、心理学家鲁特·阿古拉斯 (Rute Agulhas) 表示，“媒体对这一主题的报道已使其不再是禁忌”，并补充说该组织已收到 20自成立以来，投诉不断。

;

;但葡萄牙第一个代表神职人员性虐待受害者协会的三位创始人之一菲利帕·阿尔梅达 (Filipa Almeida) 表示，改革进展得太慢。

;<这位来自科英布拉中部地区的 43 岁男子补充道：“由于媒体的压力，我们所做的很少。”

;

;阿尔梅达在教堂忏悔室被一名牧师强奸。当她 17 岁的时候。她说她很失望没有被邀请参加教皇与虐待受害者的会议。

;

;“与他分享我们的感受，最重要的是，分享我们的感受，这一点很重要。” ”她说。

;

;葡萄牙主教团在一份声明中表示，这将是一次“私人会议”，并且“不会事先传达任何信息以保护受害者的身份” .

;

;近年来，世界各地出现了数千起天主教会内部恋童癖的报告，这对教皇构成了挑战。

;

;教皇方济各在 2018 年承认他犯了“严重错误” ” 在处理智利的一起文书性虐待丑闻时做出了判断，并邀请那些被他名誉扫地的虐待受害者前往罗马请求他们的原谅。

;

;次年，他就文书性虐待问题举行了一场史无前例的峰会，并颁布了改革，其中包括报告虐待和掩盖事实的新义务。

;

;教皇称性虐待者是令人厌恶的“敌人”，但仍应受到爱戴

;

;葡萄牙世界青年日的组织者已要求葡萄牙受害者支持协会 (APAV) 对活动工作人员和志愿者进行培训，以处理性虐待报告。

;

;该组织将出现在预计会有大量朝圣者聚集的两个地点APAV 负责儿童性虐待问题的卡拉·费雷拉 (Carla Ferreira) 表示，向任何有需要的人提供情感或法律支持。

;

;“我们在天主教会内想要的就是我们对整个教会的期望她说：“我们所看到的只是第一步，还需要做更多的事情。” .

;

;世界青年日是世界上最大的天主教活动，今年是第 16 届国际青年日，时间为 8 月 1 日至 6 日。

;

;这一周围绕一系列文化、精神和节日活动，从音乐会到辩论和祈祷会。

;

;活动针对的是 16 岁至 35 岁之间的天主教徒，但组织者表示欢迎所有人参加，无需注册。

;

; >;

;据梵蒂冈称，将有 700 多名主教和 20 名红衣主教，以及来自 200 多个国家的 20,000 名志愿者和朝圣者参加。

;

;最近的世界青年日于 2019 年在巴拿马城举行。

;男团 TFBOYS 在中国演出的门票一秒售空。黄牛们以惊人的 20 万元人民币（28,000 美元）提供前排座位，以满足巨大的需求。

;

;观看乐队表演的需求如此强烈，以至于音乐会体育场外的树木以 5,000 元的价格出租据大陆新闻媒体《蓝鲸财经》报道，对于愿意爬得足够高的歌迷来说，一小时（700 美元）——望远镜需要额外付费，摔倒保险也要额外付费

;

;中国最受欢迎的男孩乐队之一， TFBOYS，又名“战斗男孩”，拥有三名成员：24 岁的王俊凯，以及 23 岁的易烊千玺和王源，他们于 2013 年青少年时期出道。

;

;中国的音乐会观众挥金如土，但报复性支出可持续吗？

;

;根据第一财经数据，截至 2018 年，乐队的代言和品牌商业价值估计超过 4.3 亿美元.

;

;三位明星仅在微博上就有超过8000万粉丝，门票代理商并不担心收取如此高昂的票价。

;

;西安十周年演唱会据传，8 月 6 日在中国西北的陕西省是三位成员最后一次集体演出。

;

;7 月 24 日，第一批门票立即售空，估计有 5,000 张被抢购一空。短短一秒，据报道有400万粉丝失望而去。

;

;蓝鲸财经报道称，总共发售了3.3万张门票，与500万希望看到的人相比，这个数字微乎其微。在售票平台大麦上留言的群。第二轮门票将于 7 月 31 日开始发售。

;

;低价门票也出现了黑市加价，2,013 元的门票售价为 5,000 元（700 美元），一张 1,280 元的门票售价为 1,280 元。门票4500元，980元门票4000元。

;

;报道称，内场门票价格在4万至5万元之间，而前排黄牛的售价为20万元。

;

;上周，在娱乐节目主持人张大大的直播中，一位网友声称，他看到的TFBOYS的前排座位费用已飙升至200万元人民币（28万美元） ）在黑市上。

;

;“普通人一辈子也赚不到200万。 200万就可以在老家买一套房子了。”该网友说道。

;

;这几年，三位成员很少一起演出，专注于个人演艺和唱歌事业。

;

;8月演唱会西安酒店预订量较8月5日至7日平均增长30倍。

;

;TFBOYS“买不到票”话题引来数十人关注微博上千条评论。

;

;“姐妹们，青春只有一次，贷款却可以长期还。”去抢票吧！”一个人写道。

;

;“即使这会导致我卖掉我的房子或汽车，我仍然想去听音乐会。我的青春是无价的。”另一位网友说道。

;

;一位粉丝说：“我小时候就开始听他们的歌，看他们主演的电视剧。我希望能参加他们的演唱会，为我的青春留下一段美好的回忆。”

;目前中国最热门的人工智能 (AI) 应用程序是一个肖像生成器只需 9.9 元（1.4 美元）即可创建不同风格的美化头像。它是如此受欢迎，以至于消费者的需求导致服务器超载，一些用户等待超过 24 小时才能得到结果。

;

;妙鸭是腾讯控股超级市场上最受欢迎的小程序之一社交应用微信。它允许用户上传一张头像和一组20张或更多的近期照片，然后将其处理成一组风格化的肖像，包括标准证件照和专业肖像。

;

;它是如此受欢迎，因为7月17日上线，部分用户等了24小时以上才拿到头像。该节目的受欢迎甚至引发了人们的希望，即中国拥有巨大的市场，可以通过多种方式从人工智能技术中获利。

;

;成龙在快手上的直播吸引了创纪录的预订量

;

;人工智能已成为今年中国最热门的话题之一，这是由总部位于旧金山的 OpenAI 去年 11 月推出的对话机器人 ChatGPT 的热潮引发的。阿里巴巴集团、百度和京东等中国大型科技公司都纷纷加入，相信这项技术将有助于升级他们当前的服务。

;

;张丁丁，互联网行业评论员、前互联网公司负责人。北京研究公司Sootoo Institute表示，这是自ChatGPT问世以来第一个在中国流行的消费人工智能产品。 “很难说这种流行会持续多久，但可以肯定的是，市场上会出现很多类似的产品，因为这类产品的门槛不高。”张补充道。用户很可能会在微信或中国社交电子商务平台小红书上分享照片，因此该技术也具有社交联系。

;

;微信支付、Flywire 简化了海外学费支付流程

;<根据启信网企业信用信息网站的信息，秒芽的开发商是一家鲜为人知的公司，名为微旭互联网科技，该公司使用阿里巴巴旗下视频平台优酷的电子邮件联系方式。阿里巴巴还拥有《南华早报》，但没有立即回应置评请求。

;

;类似的人工智能服务已经出现。上周推出的另一款小程序45ai上线后也产生了巨大的流量。它提供的照片风格之一是基于最近热门的美国同名奇幻喜剧电影中描绘的美泰角色芭比娃娃。

;

;7 月 25 日，45ai 在小红书上发帖称，它正在体验

;

;同时，此类产品的流行是否能够转化为可持续的利润，或者是否会带来持续的利润，也是一个悬而未决的问题。成为又一个失败的中国互联网时尚。一些消费者不以为然。

;

;“我花了9.9元，等了11个小时，妙雅的摄像头拍到了我右臂胸罩鼓起的赘肉，锁骨不对称，还有一高一低的双眼皮，”一位小红书用户在周末发布的帖子中写道。

;

;27岁的上海居民Lucy Liu在朋友发送邀请码后尝试了45ai的芭比风格照片。等待了24个多小时，她对结果并不满意。 “我几乎不再了解自己了。我有一种感觉，我正在看着别人，”她说。

;

;“我喜欢生动且贴近生活的照片。我不需要看起来很假的照片。”她补充道。

;

;隐私仍然是一个问题。妙芽最初的隐私协议称，它可以“以任何形式、任何媒体或技术（现在和将来）”使用这些内容。不过，该公司后来更改了协议，称照片只会用于创建用户的数字图像。

;

;家住浙江省的张宜昌表示，她使用了妙芽相机小程序。上传20张自己的照片，是小程序生成肖像的最低要求。 “我认为结果非常接近[摄影工作室]......但我主要是在尝试[新技术]。一方面，我还是担心安全问题，另一方面，它不是真实的照片，所以我不会（在重要场合）使用它。”她说。

;周五，一头野猪袭击了一名男孩并被香港当局击毙。沙田区火炭地铁站附近的一名妇女。

;

;香港对在城市地区造成问题的动物并不陌生，因为该市平均每月约有 90 起滋扰报告。

;

; 《华盛顿邮报》采访了专家，了解野猪为什么会攻击人类以及是什么吸引它们来到城市地区。

;

;城市里的猪：香港的野猪问题 - 直观解释

;

;1。野猪为什么会攻击人类？

;

;“除非受到威胁或受伤，否则野猪很少攻击人类，”香港野猪关注组织的 Roni Wong Ho-yin 说道。< /p>;

;“根据一些报道，这起事件中的野猪在一名男孩试图用包阻止野猪后咬了他。

;

;“我们相信野猪感到受到威胁，自然选择保护自己”

;

;警方发言人表示，一名 15 岁男孩的手被咬，一名女子的腿被咬。袭击事件于上午11时15分左右发生在沙田区火炭港铁站乐景街出口附近。

;

;渔农自然护理署表示，该野猪重约70公斤（154磅），身长约70公斤。 120 厘米（四英尺）长。

;

;2.部门如何处理“滋扰”野猪？

;

;部门证实，周五袭击事件中的野猪于下午1时左右追踪到火炭路。

;

;被注射镇定剂射杀枪后来放下了。官员称，它在被捕获时“没有受伤的迹象”。

;

;在袭击人类的事件从 2021 年的 4 起急剧增加后，2021 年 11 月出台了捕捉并扑杀进入城市地区的野猪的政策。 2020 年至 2021 年 22 只。

;

;该部门早些时候已对在建筑区造成滋扰的公猪进行了绝育和重新安置。

;

;随着周五的事件发生，今年针对人类的袭击事件大幅减少这是第五起有记录的野猪，而 2022 年全年有 36 头野猪。

;

;周五袭击两人的野猪是该部门自政策改变以来捕获并杀死的第 541 头野猪。

;

;

;该部门表示，自实施扑灭野猪安全威胁措施以来，野猪滋扰黑点数量已从2021年的63个减少到2022年的42个。

;

;公开报告的野猪目击或滋扰事件也已从2021年的1,400多起下降至2022年的约1,100起，以及截至今年5月的约440起。

;

;嘉道理农场及植物园发言人加登说，针对人类的袭击事件的减少很可能是因为政府采取了阻止人们喂养野生动物的运动。

;

;“这可能反映了全市范围内禁止喂养和社区知识不断增长的影响。喂养对动物或公众都不好。”他说。

;

;政府将于 2022 年底在全市范围内实施禁止喂养野生动物的禁令。违法者最高可被罚款 10,000 港元（1,280 美元） ）。

;

;今年迄今为止，共进行了 79 次扑杀行动，宰杀了 220 头野猪，大约是去年同期的两倍。

;

;最新的部门数据表明，洪香港约有2,500头野猪。

;

;香港今年每天捕杀1头野猪；专家警告“残酷”政策

;

;3。野猪为什么会进入市区？

;

;嘉道理农场暨植物园在网上发帖称，大多数时候野猪会进入人口稠密的地区寻找食物。

;

;“不喂养野猪，这会使它们依赖人类，更有可能来到城市，”它警告说。

;

;《邮报》记者于五月访问了鲗鱼涌帕克山道，这是一个已知的野猪热点地区，发现了各种适合动物的景点。

;

;在一座寺庙里发现了当地人留下的成堆的苹果和橘子，以及为流浪猫打开的金枪鱼罐头。

;

;附近一条受欢迎的远足路径也有几个烧烤和野餐区。

;

;嘉道理发言人表示，野猪数量的增加也可能导致这些动物进入城市地区。

;

;“大型自然野生捕食者物种的数量已经下降。曾经，老虎、豹子和猎犬可以帮助控制野猪数量，但现在只剩下缅甸蟒蛇捕食野猪。”

;

;香港地铁站外攻击男孩和妇女的野猪被扑杀

;

;4。如果看到野猪，你该怎么办？

;

;“最好的办法就是保持冷静并保持安全距离，”黄说。 “如果动物受伤，请勿接近它，因为它可能会攻击。”该部门表示，野猪对人类接触保持警惕，只有在被激怒时才会攻击。

;

;“发言人表示，市民应避免接近或驱赶野猪，因为激怒野猪可能会导致危险。

;

;市民如遇到野猪，应致电1823寻求帮助。

;

;它补充说，在紧急情况下，应拨打 999 联系警方以获得立即帮助。

; Sun, 30 Jul 2023 11:20:02 +0800 Greek ecosystems face increasing fire risk, experts sayhttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/europe/article/3229386/greek-ecosystems-face-increasing-fire-risk-experts-say?utm_source=rss_feed

;两周的酷热和野火证实了人们对希腊生态系统面临越来越大风险的担忧，专家说。

;

;根据雅典国家天文台的估计，大约 50,000 公顷（123,500 英亩）的森林和植被被烧焦。

;

;这使得七月份成为了七月。天文台研究主任查拉兰波斯·康托斯 (Charalampos Kontoes) 表示，就烧毁的土地而言，这是 13 年来最严重的一次。

;

;“那是一个干燥的冬天，春雨不足以维持”土壤湿度， Kontoes 说。

;

;民防部长 Vassilis Kikilias 本周表示，工作人员本月已与 660 多起火灾作斗争，平均每天 50 至 70 起火灾。

;

;当地的企业和农场科孚岛和罗得岛旅游岛、希腊第二大岛埃维亚岛以及希腊中部沃洛斯附近的乡村今年首当其冲受到损害。

;

;希腊农民保险协会 ELGA 估计，罗德岛有 50,000 棵橄榄树、2,500 只动物和蜂箱被毁。

;

;该组织表示，在沃洛斯地区，除了农业机械和建筑物外，收获的谷物和葡萄也遭受了“重大损失”。

;

;它补充说，牲畜也遭受了重大损失。

;

;希腊每年都会遭受森林火灾。 2007年，他们在伯罗奔尼撒半岛和埃维亚造成84人死亡。 2018 年，雅典附近的海滨度假胜地马蒂 (Mati) 造成 103 人死亡。

;

;两年前，埃维亚 (Evia) 已有 3 人死亡，今年迄今已有 5 人死亡。

;

;“反复发生的火灾危及到生态系统。森林变成了农业林地，灌木丛变成了灌木丛，”希腊林业工作者联盟负责人尼科斯·博卡里斯(Nikos Bokaris)说。

;

;“景观往往会发生变化，类似于非洲的景观，”他补充道。

;

;罗德岛7月18日发生火灾，当地环境保护协会负责人格里戈里斯·迪米特里亚迪斯(Grigoris Dimitriadis)表示，当地很大一部分动物群，包括该岛标志性的小鹿，都受到了严重影响。

;

; p>;

;此外，欧盟气候观测站哥白尼周三表示，希腊山火产生的烟雾排放量是过去 21 年来这一时期最高的。

;

;Kontoes 指出，山区雅典周围平均每六年就会起一次火灾。

;

;这会影响欧洲人口最稠密的城市之一的生态系统，该城市居住着希腊 1050 万人口的三分之一以上，他说。

;

;博卡里斯补充说，希腊首都的情况尤其成问题，因为“绿地很少，混凝土建筑创造了一个封闭的热环境”。

;

;欧洲野火风险蔓延至法国里维埃拉

;

;希腊政府将火灾主要归咎于气候危机，经常被指责在保护生物多样性和预防火灾方面做得不够。

;

;“今年，预防措施开始得有点晚了，但当火灾规模变得很大时，防火带或其他预防措施并不总是万能的。”Bokaris 说。

;

;预报员表示，希腊在 2022 年收到了 5500 万欧元（6000 万美元）的资金欧洲防火基金，今年又投入 8600 万欧元。

;

;他的建议是让被烧毁的土地得到再生，并禁止将“被烧毁的森林转变为耕种或建设用地”，就像往常一样

;

;“气候危机并不是突然出现的，政府、地方当局和志愿者之间的合作是应对危机的必要条件，”希腊绿色和平组织的亚历山德拉·梅萨雷 (Alexandra Messare) 说道。

; Sun, 30 Jul 2023 10:20:02 +0800 Can Malaysia’s Umno win back Malay voters for PM Anwar’s unity government in August state polls?https://www.scmp.com/week-asia/politics/article/3229311/can-malaysias-umno-win-back-malay-voters-pm-anwars-unity-government-august-state-polls?utm_source=rss_feed

;马来西亚前执政党巫统已成为总理安瓦尔·易卜拉欣的主要推动力量他的联合政府在即将到来的一系列州选举中面临着公众支持的首次真正考验。

;

;这个马来西亚党员人数最多的古老政党将当吉兰丹、登嘉楼、吉打、槟城、雪兰莪和森美兰等州属于 8 月 12 日投票时，代表联合政府参选 245 个席位中的 107 个席位。

;

;这对巫统来说是一个很大的要求，因为在 11 月的大选中，该党几乎惨败，因为马来选民因对政党领导人腐败的众多指控而愤怒，转向由前总理穆希丁·亚辛领导的新马来民族主义联盟，该党仅赢得了 222 个席位中的 28 个席位。

;

;随着各州民意调查的临近，马来西亚总理安瓦尔面临首次“令人担忧”的考验

;

;但这也是安瓦尔联合政府的必要策略。

;

;作为他执政的条件在一场高度分裂的大选后，安瓦尔被马来西亚国王指示组建一个由朋友和敌人组成的政府，为巫统提供了一条重新进入政府的途径，尽管它失宠了。

;

;“巫统是政治风险咨询公司 BowerGroupAsia 的马来西亚董事 Adib Zalkapli 表示：“该党是联合政府的重要合作伙伴，并且被视为马来社区的代表。” “鉴于其作为联合政府中马来政党的角色，巫统必须在州选举中发挥突出作用。”

;

;巫统的任务是挑战伊斯兰伊党在北部地区近乎铁杆的控制。吉兰丹州和登嘉楼州，以及保卫自己在南部森美兰州的据点。伊党将寻求乘搭“绿色浪潮”——反映其政党色彩——这让反对党国民联盟 (PN) 联盟在 11 月的民意调查中成为议会中令人敬畏的少数派。

;

;虽然巫统在这场战争中遭受了无数伤亡，大选、执政期间数十年建立的政治网络和基层机制的努力都不会轻易撤销。

;

;巫统可以说拥有该国政党中最广泛、组织最完善的政治机制，并给予政府政策咨询公司 KRA 集团的战略总监阿米尔·法里德·阿卜杜勒·拉希姆 (Amir Fareed Abdul Rahim) 表示，它的一个重要作用是激发基层士气。

;

;“这也可能是为了安抚巫统草根阶层——其中许多人仍然对联合政府持怀疑态度，但他们的支持对于进入州选举是必要的——认为该党在联盟中发挥着关键作用，”阿米尔告诉《亚洲周刊》。

;

;

;

;然而，组织联合政府在下个月的州民意调查中采取行动的政治组织者制定的策略可能不一定能引起他们希望赢得的人民的共鸣。

;

;在伊党领导的北部吉打州——其首席部长最近因涉嫌质疑该国最富有的雪兰莪州首席部长的任命而被指控犯有两项煽动行为罪——选民认为巫统已经失败了。

;< p>;巫统多年来被指控滥用权力和腐败，这是马来选民选择相对较新的国盟的主要推动因素，其成员政党被视为更能代表马来人和伊斯兰价值观。

;

;支持者认为起诉吉打州首席部长穆罕默德·沙努西·诺 (Muhammad Sanusi Md Nor)，称其为执政联邦政府企图胁迫反对派屈服。

;

;11 月投票支持国盟的银行家扎因·舒伊布 (Zain Shuib) 表示，指控沙努西的决定只是简单的巩固了对现任州政府的支持。

;

;“我不认为巫统会在吉打获胜。 Myself and almost everyone here are voting for PN,” said Zain, who is in his 40s.

;

;Malaysia investigates opposition leader for royal insult as pre-poll tensions flare

;

;Umno's corruption baggage also looms large for housewife Shafinaz Rahim, especially after the party's former leader Najib Razak was jailed in August last year after failing to overturn his conviction for corruption linked to a former unit of scandal-tainted state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB).

;

;“I don't see why people want to support Umno again now that we have PN which is better,” Shafinaz said.

;

;“I don't think Umno has changed, they are still the same and now even PH is following [in] their steps, so they are the same,” she said, referring to Anwar's Pakatan Harapan coalition.

;

;But PN head Muhyiddin and a few other coalition leaders were charged earlier this year with corruption allegedly perpetrated during their short tenure in power during the Covid-19 years, putting both sides in the same boat, said BowerGroupAsia's Adib.

;

;“All sides are implicated, no party can claim innocence. It's a battle of personalities. It's purely a competition between political parties this time unlike 2018 when corruption was a major campaign issue,” he said, referring to the year when Umno was booted out after six decades in power.

;

;

;

;Beyond the obvious measure of the current administration's popularity, the outcome of the state elections could also determine whether Umno will continue to support Anwar and his unity government or reconsider its position in the country's political arena.

;

;A good performance – which could mean as little as adding a handful of new seats – would build a case for a more permanent partnership with Anwar's PH coalition in preparation for the next national polls that must be held by 2027 at the latest, KRA Group's Amir said.

;

;“But if it loses further ground, there will be internal pressure within the party for a realignment,” he said.

;

;“I don't think it will be the end of Umno … but it will continue its downward spiral, which means they will have to go back to the drawing board and rethink their strategies ahead of the next general election.”

; Sun, 30 Jul 2023 09:50:02 +0800 ‘I can handle this task’: viral video of adorable well-behaved girl, 3, on 10-hour China high-speed train trip impresses mainland social mediahttps://www.scmp.com/news/people-culture/trending-china/article/3229010/i-can-handle-task-viral-video-adorable-well-behaved-girl-3-10-hour-china-high-speed-train-trip?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.30 09:00;
;;

;A heartwarming online video which features a calm and composed toddler setting off on a 10-hour high-speed train journey has warmed hearts on mainland social media.

;

;The star of the clip– which captures a situation most parents dread and often entails tantrums and tears – is an adorable three-year-old girl from Suzhou in the eastern province of Jiangsu.

;

;The clip, shared on Feidian Video, shows the little girl seated on the high-speed train beside her mother, declaring: “I'm going to travel by high-speed rail, and it takes 10 hours. If I can persist, then I'm a baby who works hard.”

;

;Throughout the journey, the mother engages in a series of conversations with her daughter, guiding her self-discipline.

;

;“Can you persist for the 10-hour high-speed train journey?” the mother asks in the video.

;

;“Yes, I can!” the girl says confidently.

;

;Her mother then says: “Are you going to yell and kick the seats?”, to which the well-behaved toddler responds: “No! I won't cause any trouble to others.”

;

;Then the conversation turns to food as the mother asks: “What are you going to do in the carriage for such a long time?”

;

;“I can eat when I feel hungry,” the girl says excitedly.

;

;The video goes on to show various aspects of the child's cool and calm demeanour as she eats fruit, has lunch, reads children's picture books, and even takes a nap.

;

;Eight hours into the journey the mother praises her by saying: “It's not easy, you have persisted for eight hours, how are you feeling?”

;

;The girl proudly replies: “I feel pretty good about myself.”

;

;“Can you hold on for two more hours?” asks her mother.

;

;“I can persist for two hours, three hours, eight hours, even 100 hours. Don't worry! I will definitely be able to persist in this task,” the girl declares.

;

;After the video went viral, the girl's father, surnamed Song, revealed that he was not surprised at his daughter's discipline.

;

;Song told the media outlet Xi Bu Jue Ce: “I started guiding her when she was just over one year old. I tell her that if you can do things by yourself, then do it yourself. It is important to cultivate her independence and self-reliance from an early age.”

;

;The heartwarming video has struck a chord online with people whose experience with young children on long journeys was not quite so pleasant.

;

;One online observer said: “I recommended this be played on the high-speed rail as a promotional video.”

;

;“High-quality parents can teach well-behaved children,” said another.

;

;While a third person added: “So, yelling on the train is not the child's responsibility, but the parents who don't educate them.”

;

;Disruptive behaviour by children on trains in China can often lead to unsavoury outcomes.

;

;On July 24, an online poster shared a video claiming that he took a high-speed train in Hunan province in southern China and had to endure two boys playing football in the carriage for two and a half hours while their parents looked on.

;

;On May 2, a woman claimed that while travelling on a high-speed train she was slapped by a parent for stopping a child who was kicking her seat from behind.

; Sun, 30 Jul 2023 09:20:02 +0800 As US-China relations fray, expect more shows of China-North Korea unity, analysts sayhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3229299/us-china-relations-fray-expect-more-shows-china-north-korea-unity-analysts-say?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.30 09:00;
;;

;Visits by Chinese and Russian delegations to North Korea last week highlight stronger ties between Beijing, Moscow and Pyongyang as those nations try to resist Washington's Indo-Pacific strategy, according to analysts.

;

;Li Hongzhong, a member of the Politburo, the Communist Party's 24-member decision-making body, along with Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu, attended a military parade in Pyongyang on Thursday to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the Korean war armistice.

;

;North backs Russia's 'battle for justice' as Kim shows off missiles to minister

;

;“The Chinese side, together with the North Korean side, has a willingness to promote sound and stable development of China-North Korea relations, provide the peoples of the two countries with happiness and make a positive contribution to achieving regional peace and stability, prosperity and development,” Li said during a welcome banquet on Wednesday, according to North Korean state media.

;

;Li and Shoigu are among the first foreign guests Pyongyang has invited into the country since it was locked down during the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020. Li is the first Chinese official to visit North Korea since Chinese President Xi Jinping's state visit in 2019.

;

;The military parade, hosted by North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, featured the country's most advanced intercontinental ballistic missiles – the Hwasong-17 and Hwasong-18.

;

;The missiles are believed to have a range of 15,000km (9,320 miles), making them capable of striking the US mainland. The Hwasong-18, which was test-fired earlier this month following its first test in April, is said to be better at avoiding pre-emptive strikes because it uses solid-fuel engines and takes less time to prepare than liquid-fuel propellants.

;

;The event also showcased newly developed surveillance and multi-role attack drones. Kim's visit to a weaponry exhibition with Shoigu the previous day featured similar aircraft that appeared to be modelled after the US Global Hawk unmanned aircraft system.

;

;The presence of the Chinese and Russian delegations at the war commemoration suggested increasingly closer ties between the three countries – communist allies during the Korean war – in the face of rising US-China tensions.

;

;Park Won-gon, a professor of North Korean studies at Ewha Womans University in Seoul, said China and North Korea interpreted the Korean war with a similar historical narrative – resisting the United States and uniting against it – allowing the 70th anniversary of the armistice to be used by Beijing and Pyongyang to show off strong ties.

;

;70 years on, the threat of war still hangs over Korea

;

;“Since they say that it is a war against the US and that they have won, there is definitely a side that agrees with such a historical interpretation,” Park said.

;

;“There is a need for North Korea and China to strengthen their camps and cooperation against the US.”

;

;On Wednesday, Kim visited a cemetery for Chinese soldiers who died in the Korean war, which Chinese foreign ministry spokeswoman Mao Ning said reflected “the inheritance and development of the traditional friendship between China and North Korea in the new historical period”.

;

;Park said Kim might try to use the visits by the Chinese and Russians to further his agenda. “Having the delegations from China and Russia at the military parade could be an effective way to promote Kim's achievements,” Park said.

;

;“Although China and Russia are not explicit, it can suggest their tacit agreement on North Korea's nuclear development.”

;

;Washington, meanwhile, has been trying again to pressure Beijing to use its leverage on Pyongyang to return to denuclearisation talks.

;

;“We believe that Beijing has influence over Pyongyang, and we hope that it will use that influence to encourage Pyongyang to return to dialogue and refrain from destabilising activities,” US State Department spokesman Vedant Patel said on Thursday, in reference to the Chinese visit to North Korea.

;

;Washington has also boosted cooperation with Seoul and Tokyo. A summit between US President Joe Biden and his South Korean and Japanese counterparts, Yoon Suk-yeol and Fumio Kishida, is scheduled at Camp David on August 18.

;

;Park said the strengthening ties between the US, South Korea and Japan – which is also expanding cooperation with other bodies such as Nato – had prompted China, North Korea and Russia to respond by promoting their “unity of convenience”.

;

;“From China's point of view, the biggest and the core variable in China-North Korea ties is US-China relations. Depending on the development of US-China relations, Beijing always views Pyongyang as either an asset or a liability,” Park said.

;

;“Considering that there is a low chance of structural improvement in US-China relations, the unity and cooperation between China and North Korea will continue for the time being.”

;

;Cho Han-bum, a senior research fellow at Seoul-based think tank Korea Institute of National Unification, said that in addition to the US-China rivalry and North Korea's nuclear development, the war in Ukraine had also motivated Beijing, Moscow and Pyongyang to be “aligned for a common interest” against Washington.

;

;“North Korea-China-Russia are strengthening their cooperation in response to the South Korea-US-Japan ties,” Cho said. “In the case of China, it needs a strategic asset called North Korea against pressure from the US and Japan.”

;

;“In the future, North Korea-China and North Korea-Russia relations will become more important to all three countries.”

;She said the cheaper yen and relatively high number of flights could have made Japan attractive to Hong Kong travellers.

;Tokyo, Osaka and Fukuoka were among the top five destinations booked through Expedia for July and August, along with Bangkok and Taipei. The rest of the top 10 were London, Kaohsiung, Seoul, Phuket and Okinawa.

;

;Hong Kong is experiencing strong travel demand, despite more expensive ticket prices which have allowed airlines to recoup losses incurred during the Covid-19 pandemic.

;

;The city's flag carrier, Cathay Pacific Airways, this month said it expected to post a net profit of up to HK$4.5 billion (US$577 million) for the first half of 2023, following three straight years of losses.

;

;Hong Kong visitors to Japan reached almost 90 per cent of pre-pandemic levels in June, becoming the fourth-biggest group of travellers there.

;

;There were 2.07 million visitors to Japan in June, with 186,300 from Hong Kong, behind South Korea (545,100), mainland China (208, 500) and Taiwan (389,000), according to Japanese government data.

;

;Lily Agonoy, managing director of Jebsen Travel, told the Post “revenge travel”, which refers to people's pent-up desire to go abroad after three years of the pandemic, was held back by the limited number of seats and higher airfares, except for Japan.

;

;“Revenge travel applies from Hong Kong to Japan, because if you look at the flights that Cathay Pacific, HK Express and Hong Kong Airlines are adding, there are a lot and the flights are full,” she said.

;

;The travel agency found that airfares from Hong Kong were between 10 and 50 per cent more expensive than in 2019.

;

;A Cathay Pacific economy class return ticket to Tokyo was 57 per cent higher on average this year than in 2019, London was six per cent higher and New York was 45 per cent higher.

;

;Economy class return air tickets to Taipei on Taiwanese carrier Eva Air were 39 per cent higher.

;

;Importing labour to Hong Kong will ensure 'more flights, help bring down airfares'

;

;One reason for the higher fares, Agonoy said, was that not as many airlines were flying to Hong Kong compared with before the pandemic, and Cathay Pacific itself was operating at below 60 per cent of its pre-pandemic passenger levels.

;

;Her advice for travellers was to book early and be flexible on their dates and destination.

;

;“If they're considering Japan, maybe also consider going to Korea or Taiwan. If there are good deals, go to that destination,” she said.

;

;Herman Tse, senior aviation analyst at Ascend by Cirium, said the firm expected fares from Hong Kong to remain high throughout the year.

;

;Holiday in Fukushima? From dark tourism to 'hope tourism' 12 years on

;

;Cathay Pacific Group, which includes HK Express, has targeted achieving 70 per cent of its pre-pandemic passenger capacity by the end of the year, while Hong Kong Airlines was aiming to hit 75 per cent.

;

;Emirates chief commercial officer Adnan Kazim told the Post on the sidelines of a meeting of more than 300 airline executives in Istanbul last month that airfares should “balance out” by next year.

;

;The Dubai-based carrier currently flies twice a day to Hong Kong and hoped to add a third daily flight to meet demand.

;

;Alan Joyce, outgoing CEO of Australian carrier Qantas, who was also at the International Air Transport Association (IATA) annual meeting, said airfares were easing from last year's highs as the airline added more seats.

;

;Japan is 'rammed' with visitors – and Chinese tourists aren't even back yet

;

;He added that Qantas expected its international seat capacity to be at “full levels” by next March.

;

;“We're doing everything we can to get that capacity up and running and that is the big function of moving air fares down internationally,” he said.

;The wreckage of an ancient Roman cargo ship carrying hundreds of terra cotta jars has been found off the coast of Italy, authorities said on Friday.

;

;The ship – believed to have sunk more than 2,000 years ago – was found on the bottom of the Mediterranean Sea off the coast of Civitavecchia, a port city just northwest of Rome.

;

;The “exceptional discovery” was announced by the Carabinieri Art Squad, a division of the Carabinieri Police in charge of protecting Italy's cultural heritage. Officials described it as “an important example of the sinking of a Roman ship which faced the perils of the sea in an attempt to reach the coast and bears witness to the ancient maritime trade routes,” according to The Guardian newspaper.

;

;The vessel dates back to the first or second century BC and was filled with hundreds of amphorae, a type of terra cotta jar, which were found mostly intact, the Rome-based newspaper la Repubblica reported.

;

;The shipwreck was located by the Art Squad and divers from the National Superintendency for Underwater Cultural Heritage.

;

;Experts used a remotely operated vehicle system that included a patrol boat, a sonar and a depth sounder.

;

;New finds in Italian archaeological park include Eros riding a dolphin

;

;The amphorae were placed on the bottom of the ship, which is estimated to measure around 65 feet long.

;

;It's not yet clear what the containers were used for, authorities said.

;

;In December 2019, wreckage from another Roman vessel discovered in the Mediterranean included around 6,000 amphorae. Remains of that ship, believed to have also sunk around 2,000 years ago, were found near the Greek island of Kefalonia in the Ionian Sea.
